intro: Mesembryanthemum pearsonii, commonly known as the pearson's ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, yellow, and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. Its leaves are fleshy and adapted to store water, making it drought-tolerant. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
